content.p: Determine, in factored form, a formula for a rational function whose graph has the features shown.
Explain, in one sentence each, the reason for the factors that appear in your formula.

outtro.p: A factored form for the original graph might be: \displaystyle f(x) = {{A}}\frac{ {{num}} }{ {{den}} } .

content.p: Squinting, you discover that you missed a feature of the graph: a "hole" in the graph at the point ({{hx}},{{hy}}).

image.description: Graph of rational function with listed features

content.p: Modify your answer to Task #1 to determine a formula for this new "punctured" graph, in factored form.

outtro.p: When the "hole" at ({{hx}},{{hy}}) is included, \displaystyle f(x) = {{A}}\frac{ {{numh}} }{ {{denh}} } .

content.p: Multiply and simplify your answers to Tasks #1 and #2. Explain briefly why the factored form of a rational expression gives more helpful information about it than this standard form does.

outtro.p: The function in Task 1 simplifies to \displaystyle f(x) = \frac{ {{nums}} }{ {{dens}} }.
The function in Task 2 simplifies to \displaystyle f(x) = \frac{ {{numhs}} }{ {{denhs}} }.
